image.altText: Two teens in balaclavas flank another teen carrying a weight.

props.synopsis: A taxpayer-funded mentoring program for at-risk Tasmanian youths posted footage on social media showing workers at a camp dressed in black clothes and balaclavas.

title.children: 'Wrong kind of message': Workers at camp for at-risk youth dressed in balaclavas

image.altText: A digital rendering of the inside of a stadium.

props.synopsis: Cricket Tasmania and the Macquarie Point stadium proponent believe they have found the solution to concerns about how the stadium's roof could affect cricket.

title.children: Concerns about proposed stadium roof solved, Cricket Tasmania says

image.altText: Six puppy labradoodles in a cage

props.synopsis: A position paper sets out limits for breeders and proposes an information sharing system for better regulation.

title.children: Tasmania's dog welfare overhaul to help stamp out puppy farms

image.altText: Pink sand in a dish with a spoon.

props.synopsis: Thirteen public schools will remain closed on Thursday, and another 22 will remain partially closed. Several non-government schools are also closed or partially closed as education authorities respond to the recall of coloured sand products found to contain traces of asbestos.

title.children: When will Tasmanian schools affected by the coloured sand recall reopen?

image.altText: A photo taken from behind of rows of students sitting at desks in black hoodies with "class of 25" written in white and red.

props.synopsis: One parent says her child's cohort at Hobart College was initially given an incorrect formula sheet for their biology exam.

title.children: Parents frustrated by more exam errors months after review

image.altText: Supermarkets shelves, where water is usually stocked, have been stripped bare.

props.synopsis: Residents along the NT coast are preparing for a rare November cyclone to make landfall on Saturday by cutting down tree branches, stocking up on goods and making decisions about where to bunker down.

title.children: Top End residents start preparing for Tropical Cyclone Fina

image.altText: A child drinks water from a bubbler.

props.synopsis: Large studies conclude there is no evidence to back up community concerns that fluoride in water at recommended levels may affect the cognition or IQ of children.

title.children: Is fluoride in water toxic? Here's what decades of research tells us

image.altText: Four containers with coloured sand inside.

props.synopsis: An after-school hours operator says an asbestos removal company wanted to charge her more than $14,000 to vacuum up a small amount of coloured sand that spilled onto carpet at a regional New South Wales primary school.

title.children: Care provider quoted $14k to remove a 'few clumps' of coloured sand

image.altText: Donald Trump walks outdoors on to a red carpet dressed in a suit.

props.synopsis: Before the Epstein files vote, Washington woke to a zero-degree morning, and Marjorie Taylor Greene could see the symbolism. "My first thought was: hell has froze over," she said.

title.children: 'Hell has froze over': Trump's new nemesis saw the signs before Epstein vote

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, dressed in a suit, gestures as he  speaks.

props.synopsis: The federal government has begun to contact Pacific leaders to canvass a COP31 "Plan B" which would see Adelaide abandon its bid for the global United Nations climate summit so long as Pacific nations are guaranteed a role in next year's conference.

title.children: Government canvasses Pacific leaders on backdown option for COP31

image.altText: Ash streams kilometres into the sky from a green field

props.synopsis: Indonesia's Mount Semeru volcano, Java Island's tallest mountain, erupted on Wednesday, local time, prompting authorities there to raise the threat level to its highest.

title.children: Indonesian volcanic eruption prompts aviation warning in Australia

image.altText: Chris Bowen speaks at a podium.

props.synopsis: Australia has ceded the COP31 climate summit to Türkiye but Climate Change Minister Chris Bowen will be the president of the summit pending Ankara's approval. Follow live.

title.children: Australia drops push to host COP31, Chris Bowen to lead summit

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'You bet he can': Albanese confident Bowen can hold ministerial role and be COP president
Compromise with Türkiye an 'outstanding result': PM
Albanese refuses to be drawn on cost of attracting COP to Adelaide

image.altText: Three young people standing in a courtyard with serious looks on their faces holding a protest sign

props.synopsis: The University of Wollongong is considering redundancies at a well-regarded support service for victim-survivors of sexual assault.

title.children: Uni students furious at 'shameful' plans to cut support service staff

image.altText: A black and white photo of a naval vessel at sea, taken from a bird's eye perspective.

props.synopsis: The Russian vessel had directed lasers at pilots of surveillance aircraft monitoring its activities.

title.children: 'We see you': UK warns Russia as spy ship nears British waters

image.altText: Rescue workers put out a fire of a residential building

props.synopsis: A Russian drone and missile barrage has killed 25 people, including two children, in a western Ukrainian city, around 200 kilometres from the Polish border.

title.children: Children among 25 killed in Russian drone and missile attack in Ukraine

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair speaks into a microphone on stage.

props.synopsis: The ARIAs belonged to two relative underdogs this year. Don't know who they are? It's time to pay attention.

title.children: Meet the two artists who dominated this year's ARIAs

image.altText: A blonde woman in a pink dress looks at a woman with green skin who wears a witch's hat and holds a broomstick.

props.synopsis: Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo shine in Wicked: For Good, but does the sequel live up to the thrill of its predecessor?

title.children: Wicked: For Good saved by the magnetic performances of its stars

image.altText: A curly-haired man cleans a window.

props.synopsis: A multinational company is taking a small-town Australian cleaner to court, claiming his glass-cleaning product is deceptively similar to its own.

title.children: Multinational company sues small-town cleaner over packaging

image.altText: Shepparton car thief leaves baby in a box

props.synopsis: Police search for a man who stole a car with a sleeping baby in the back seat from a supermarket car park in northern Victoria, before dumping the child in a box and driving away.

title.children: Police "horrified" as baby abandoned in box during car theft

image.altText: A unidentifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: A Perth childcare centre is fined after a child escaped last year, likely by using his "above-average" climbing skills to scale a fence.

title.children: Childcare centre fined $50k after child escapes, wanders onto road

image.altText: Crime scene tape outside a home.

props.synopsis: Two trucks collided in the Canoona area at 10:40pm on Wednesday, resulting in the deaths of a toddler and a woman in her 20s, who were passengers in one of the vehicles.

title.children: Woman and child killed in Bruce Highway truck crash

image.altText: A wounded Palestinian receives treatment, he has bandages on his head and arm

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says its forces struck Hamas targets across Gaza after members of the Palestinian militant group fired on its troops in violation of the nearly six-week-old ceasefire.

title.children: Israeli air strikes kill 25 in Gaza as military continues attacking Lebanon

image.altText: Nvidia logo and rising stock graph are seen in this illustration

props.synopsis: The ASX is poised for gains this morning, with above-forecast third-quarter results for Nvidia sending the AI darling up in after-hours US trade. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Nvidia profits beat expectations and ASX set to rise

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Banking regulator fires warning shot on 'higher risk' home lending
Nvidia shares up more than 5% after-hours

image.altText: A composite image of Jofra Archer (left) and Mark Wood.

props.synopsis: England is yet to confirm its final XI, but damaging fast bowlers Jofra Archer and Mark Wood may team up to take on Australia in Perth.

title.children: England names firebrand quicks for first Ashes Test

image.altText: julie inman grant speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: Australia's online safety regulator, Julie Inman Grant, has been labelled a "zealot" and called to testify before US Congress over concerns her office is censoring the internet for Americans.

title.children: eSafety commissioner labelled 'zealot' and beckoned before US Congress

image.altText: Rescue workers put out a fire of a residential building

props.synopsis: A Russian drone and missile barrage has killed 25 people, including two children, in a western Ukrainian city, around 200 kilometres from the Polish border.

title.children: Children among 25 killed in Russian drone and missile attack in Ukraine

image.altText: A graphic image of a person holding about 10 nangs, which are small cannisters of nitrous oxide.

props.synopsis: Nitrous oxide bulbs and canisters, known colloquially as nangs, can lead to paralysis when consumed in large quantities over an extended period of time.

title.children: Nangs to be seized under new Queensland laws

image.altText: Fire rises high above blackened buildings and treetops at night

props.synopsis: Authorities are still working to extinguish the blaze, which has spread to nearby woodland.

title.children: One person killed and 170 buildings damaged by fire in Japan

image.altText: group of male soccer player wearing yellow kit with black shorts, player in the middle lifting trophy above head.

props.synopsis: Although only semi-professional footballers, these players are helping reshape the face of the game for less-established football nations, while representing their heritage.

title.children: These semi-pros are changing the face of international football

image.altText: the front gate of mine with the sign SIMEC

props.synopsis: A restriction on Tahmoor Coal's licence will not be removed until $29.4 million in outstanding royalties are paid to the NSW government.

title.children: NSW tells Gupta we’re not giving you any special treatment, pay your debts first

image.altText: A smiling man fixing a bicycle

props.synopsis: Harri Jokinen is one of several people who died from accidents during pursuits involving NSW Police.

title.children: 'The day my Dad was killed, I was killed too': Police pursuit death wrecks family

image.altText: For lease sign

props.synopsis: Legal experts say Victoria's new rental dispute resolution body is prioritising speed over fairness, pressuring renters to settle or act against their own interests.

title.children: Victorian rental dispute body asked tenants to 'forgo rights', legal experts say

image.altText: Willem Duursma and Harley Reid pose with a West Coast Eagles guernsey at the draft

props.synopsis: After being selected as the first overall pick in the AFL draft, Willem Duursma is excited about the prosect of teaming up with Eagles star Harley Reid next season.

title.children: Why top draft pick Duursma wants to be West Coast's 'Batman'

image.altText: A man on a car bonnet at night time makes a phone gesture with his right hand

props.synopsis: A road rage attack that saw a motorcyclist ride a P-plater's bonnet all the way to a police station has cost him his licence for eight months.

title.children: Road-raging rider loses licence over bonnet ride to police station
